articles.headline: Judge Strikes Down Florida’s Ban on Transgender Care for Minors
articles.snippet: A federal judge ruled that Florida could not “prohibit transgender minors from receiving specific kinds of widely accepted gender-affirming medical care.”
articles.abstract: A federal judge ruled that Florida could not “prohibit transgender minors from receiving specific kinds of widely accepted gender-affirming medical care.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Key parts of a Florida law that bans gender transition care for minors and imposes hurdles on adults seeking such care are unconstitutional, a federal judge ruled on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Hunter Biden Found Guilty on Charges Related to Gun Purchase in 2018
articles.snippet: The president’s son was convicted of three felonies during a trial that made his struggles with drug addiction painfully public.
articles.abstract: The president’s son was convicted of three felonies during a trial that made his struggles with drug addiction painfully public.
articles.lead_paragraph: A jury in Wilmington, Del., on Tuesday found Hunter Biden, President Biden’s son, guilty of three felony counts for lying on a federal firearms application, a shattering blow for the Biden family in the middle of an unforgiving presidential election campaign.
articles.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Eileen Sullivan and Zach Montague

articles.headline: Every Dollar Counts. To Pay for the War, Ukraine Embraces Privatization
articles.snippet: The government hopes to sell off a range of companies to fund the military and stabilize the economy as the grueling conflict with Russia drains its coffers.
articles.abstract: The government hopes to sell off a range of companies to fund the military and stabilize the economy as the grueling conflict with Russia drains its coffers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Towering over Kyiv for six decades, Hotel Ukraine has witnessed some pivotal moments in Ukraine’s recent history.
articles.byline: By Constant Méheut and Daria Mitiuk

articles.headline: Buyers Snap Up Aging and Empty Office Buildings for Deep Discounts
articles.snippet: Bargain hunters are getting deals of up to 70 percent, a sign of the pain in the commercial property market that could lead to large losses for banks and investors in real-estate-backed loans.
articles.abstract: Bargain hunters are getting deals of up to 70 percent, a sign of the pain in the commercial property market that could lead to large losses for banks and investors in real-estate-backed loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: A perfect storm of plunging property values for aging buildings, weak tenant demand coming out of the pandemic and high interest rates for new loans and refinancing has left the $2.4 trillion office building sector wobbling.

articles.headline: Losing a Bridge Upends Life in Baltimore (and It May Soon Get Worse)
articles.snippet: Congestion has increased on other routes in the city and residents are worried that traffic will get worse as the port returns to more normal operations.
articles.abstract: Congestion has increased on other routes in the city and residents are worried that traffic will get worse as the port returns to more normal operations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Frank’s Bay Tavern in the neighborhood of South Baltimore — house cocktail: the grain alcohol Bay Slinger — has been hit hard by the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
articles.byline: By Peter Eavis and Alyssa Schukar

articles.headline: The Fed Holds Rates Steady and Predicts Just One Reduction This Year
articles.snippet: Federal Reserve officials signaled that interest rates could stay higher this year as policymakers pause to ensure they’ve stamped out inflation.
articles.abstract: Federal Reserve officials signaled that interest rates could stay higher this year as policymakers pause to ensure they’ve stamped out inflation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials left interest rates unchanged at their June meeting on Wednesday and predicted that they will cut borrowing costs just once before the end of 2024, taking a cautious approach as they try to avoid declaring a premature victory over inflation.

articles.headline: A Palestinian Professor Spoke Out Against the Gaza War. Israel Detained Her.
articles.snippet: The investigation of Prof. Nadera Shalhoub-Kevorkian of Hebrew University has prompted a debate inside Israel about the repression of free speech and academic freedoms since the war began.
articles.abstract: The investigation of Prof. Nadera Shalhoub-Kevorkian of Hebrew University has prompted a debate inside Israel about the repression of free speech and academic freedoms since the war began.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nadera Shalhoub-Kevorkian, a Palestinian professor at a prominent Israeli university, first waded into the debate over the Gaza war by joining academics worldwide in signing a letter that called for a cease-fire. It branded Israel’s assault on the territory a “genocide” and the leaders of her university responded by urging her to resign.
articles.byline: By Damien Cave and Rawan Sheikh Ahmad

articles.headline: European Union Hits E.V.s From China With Extra Tariffs Up to 38%
articles.snippet: Leaders in Brussels, Washington and beyond are trying to curb China’s automobile ambitions amid rising trade tensions and fears of a glut of Chinese cars flooding global markets.
articles.abstract: Leaders in Brussels, Washington and beyond are trying to curb China’s automobile ambitions amid rising trade tensions and fears of a glut of Chinese cars flooding global markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: The European Union said on Wednesday that it would impose additional tariffs of up to 38 percent on electric vehicles imported from China into the bloc, in what E.U. leaders called an effort to protect the region’s manufacturers from unfair competition.

articles.headline: Saudi Arabia’s Next Billion-Dollar Sports Play: A Boxing Takeover
articles.snippet: A proposal awaiting financing would attempt to bring together dozens of the world’s best boxers in a single, Saudi-run pro league.
articles.abstract: A proposal awaiting financing would attempt to bring together dozens of the world’s best boxers in a single, Saudi-run pro league.
articles.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia has already launched a hostile takeover of professional golf. It has invested billions of dollars in world soccer. Now it wants to own professional boxing, too.

articles.headline: Tesla Investors to Decide if Musk Deserves $45 Billion Payday
articles.snippet: The vote is seen as a referendum on the limits of executive pay and the accountability of Silicon Valley billionaires.
articles.abstract: The vote is seen as a referendum on the limits of executive pay and the accountability of Silicon Valley billionaires.
articles.lead_paragraph: Under Elon Musk’s leadership, Tesla popularized electric vehicles and became the most valuable auto company in the world. Mr. Musk became a billionaire many times over while generating huge profits for investors.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Peter Eavis
